page.title: 02OPEN GOLF,ROYAL BIRKDALE
page.content: The British Open Golf Championship is an event of major golfing importance, held annually,on various specially selected golf courses.In 1983 this event was held at the Royal Birkdale golf course,Birkdale,Southport. The Royal Birkdale golf course is of average to extreme difficulty (depending on the par of the hole in play).Apart from the fact that it is traditional to hold the competition at Birkdale every seven years or so, the area also has several other features in its favour.Birkdale is reasonably accessible,it is in a pleasant position,there is little objection from local people and most of all there is an abundance of spare land. Much of this spare land belongs to Greenbank High School as the 4 to 5 acres of school playing fields back on to the practice area of the club.
